alert.note: Alert for Western Chippewa; Western Mackinac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 3:55AM EST until January 27 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Locally higher amounts of 4 to 6 inches possible. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Western Chippewa and Western Mackinac Counties. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Significant visibility reductions are expected with the passing of a concentrated band of snow early this afternoon into early this evening. Snowfall rates near 1 inch per hour combined with strong wind gusts may even lead to brief whiteout conditions, especially along US-2. Blowing snow across open areas could further reduce visibility. Snow accumulations on roadways may lead to slippery driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
